intro: Cyclorhiza puana, commonly known as the golden star orchid, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow and green flowers with a distinctive star-shaped pattern. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and leathery, adapted to retain moisture in its natural habitat. Cyclorhiza puana is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its cultural significance in traditional practices.
